model
Class PartitionGraph

java.lang.Object
  model.PartitionGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGraph<Partition>
public class PartitionGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGraph<Partition>

This class implements a partition graph. Nodes are sets of messages (MessageEvent) and edges are not maintained explicitly, but generated on-the-fly by class Partition. PartitionGraph maintains a member stateGraph which represents the state based graph version of the partition graph. To ensure that stateGraph reflects the current shape of the graph, PartitionGraphs can only be modified via the method apply which takes a object implementing Operation. Operations must perform changes on both representations.

Author:
sigurd

Constructor Detail

PartitionGraph

public PartitionGraph(IGraph<MessageEvent> g)

PartitionGraph

public PartitionGraph(IGraph<MessageEvent> g,
                      boolean partitionByLabel)
Construct a PartitionGraph. Invariants from g will be extracted and stored. If partitionByLabel is true, all messages with identical labels in g will become one partition. Otherwise, every message gets its own partition (useful if only coarsening is to be performed)

Parameters:
g - - the initial graph
partitionByLabel - - whether initial partitioning by label should be done
